version_description:
With the WooCommerce mobile app, you’ve got your online store in your pocket: manage orders, receive sales notifications, and view key metrics on the go.

Drumroll, please: it’s our very first public release! We’re looking forward to iterating early and often and we can’t wait to hear your feedback and improvement suggestions.
Get in touch via “Support” in the app or at ideas.woocommerce.com.

Thank you to everyone involved in development and early testing!

== What's new in this version ==
- You’ll now see more helpful information if we’re having trouble connecting to your site.

With the WooCommerce mobile app, you’ve got your online store in your pocket: manage orders, receive sales notifications, and view key metrics on the go.

Drumroll, please: it’s our very first public release! We’re looking forward to iterating early and often and we can’t wait to hear your feedback and improvement suggestions.
Get in touch via “Support” in the app or at ideas.woocommerce.com.

Thank you to everyone involved in development and early testing!

== What's new in this version ==
- You’ll now see more helpful information if we’re having trouble connecting to your site.

This update is all about improved reliability and fixes:
- Improved localization support on My Store charts and on the Orders & Notifications screens.
- The app now hides orders that have a created date listed in the future. (They no longer display under the “Today” section of an order list.)
- We’ve removed the payment method summary in the payment section when no payment has been received.
- Taxes line is now shown in payments and product details even when the amount to show is zero.
- When logging out, the app now resets the credential used with support requests.
- Bugfix: Sales totals on dashboard weren't matching gross sales totals from the web in all cases.

This update is all about improved reliability and fixes:
- Improved localization support on My Store charts and on the Orders & Notifications screens.
- The app now hides orders that have a created date listed in the future. (They no longer display under the “Today” section of an order list.)
- We’ve removed the payment method summary in the payment section when no payment has been received.
- Taxes line is now shown in payments and product details even when the amount to show is zero.
- When logging out, the app now resets the credential used with support requests.
- Bugfix: Sales totals on dashboard weren't matching gross sales totals from the web in all cases.

- Sometimes store stats were inconsistent across different screens. Your stats should be trustworthy, and now they are, with improvements to how store stats they’re displayed.
- The best help is help that’s there when you need it, so we added a help button to the Store Picker screen.
- You can now view and share application logs. The logs help us track down any issues you might run into, so we can ensure that using the app is smooth and bug-free.

- Sometimes store stats were inconsistent across different screens. Your stats should be trustworthy, and now they are, with improvements to how store stats they’re displayed.
- The best help is help that’s there when you need it, so we added a help button to the Store Picker screen.
- You can now view and share application logs. The logs help us track down any issues you might run into, so we can ensure that using the app is smooth and bug-free.

- Manage more than one store? You can switch sites without logging in and out: head to Settings and tap on Switch Store. The name of the active store displays on the “My Store” tab.
- When adding a note or fulfilling an order fails, the message box now shows a “Retry” option so you can give it another go.
- You don’t only take payments in round numbers, so orders can now have decimal quantities.

- Manage more than one store? You can switch sites without logging in and out: head to Settings and tap on Switch Store. The name of the active store displays on the “My Store” tab.
- When adding a note or fulfilling an order fails, the message box now shows a “Retry” option so you can give it another go.
- You don’t only take payments in round numbers, so orders can now have decimal quantities.

- Visit the Order Details screen to manually change an order’s status or view shipment tracking.
- We now fully support and properly display custom order status labels.
- You can now filter by custom order status.
- RTL language support has been improved, with better handling of graphical component flipping.

- Visit the Order Details screen to manually change an order’s status or view shipment tracking.
- We now fully support and properly display custom order status labels.
- You can now filter by custom order status.
- RTL language support has been improved, with better handling of graphical component flipping.

This version is all about fixes and refinements:
– In Order Details, the order status now refreshes upon pull-to-refresh.
– Some small UI refinements have been done in different screens.

This version is all about fixes and refinements:
– In Order Details, the order status now refreshes upon pull-to-refresh.
– Some small UI refinements have been done in different screens.
- Stay top of orders with fewer taps: now, you can copy tracking numbers right to the pasteboard from the order details screen.
- Stay top of orders with fewer taps: now, you can copy tracking numbers right to the pasteboard from the order details screen.
* You can now log in using a site address instead of your email address.
* You can now log in using a site address instead of your email address.

* You can now log in using a site address instead of your email address.
* Fixed a bug where Order List did not load for some users.

* You can now log in using a site address instead of your email address.
* Fixed a bug where Order List did not load for some users.

* Support for large text sizes has been improved.
* Fixed a bug where Order List did not load for some users.
* Updated the app to support iOS 12.0 and up.

* Support for large text sizes has been improved.
* Fixed a bug where Order List did not load for some users.
* Updated the app to support iOS 12.0 and up.

* Do you use the Shipment Tracking plugin? Now you can manually add shipment tracking to orders.
* Sometimes when you’d try to view your store’s Top Performers you’d get an “Unable to load content” error, which was an ironic lack of top performance on the app’s part. That’s fixed now.
* If you ever tried to use the Store Picker but weren’t able to continue after logging in, that’s fixed too.
* Occasionally, the app would crash when it had a slow network connection. Now it doesn’t, because iffy wifi should never stop you from managing your business.

* Do you use the Shipment Tracking plugin? Now you can manually add shipment tracking to orders.
* Sometimes when you’d try to view your store’s Top Performers you’d get an “Unable to load content” error, which was an ironic lack of top performance on the app’s part. That’s fixed now.
* If you ever tried to use the Store Picker but weren’t able to continue after logging in, that’s fixed too.
* Occasionally, the app would crash when it had a slow network connection. Now it doesn’t, because iffy wifi should never stop you from managing your business.

* We now support larger font sizes on the login screen.
* Dates on the Order Details screen are now localized.

* We now support larger font sizes on the login screen.
* Dates on the Order Details screen are now localized.

* Arabic, Hebrew, Farsi, and Urdu speakers rejoice: there’s improved support for RTL languages in the Dashboard.
* Get more info at a tap: Tapping on a product in any order will bring up a view-only version of the product details.

* Arabic, Hebrew, Farsi, and Urdu speakers rejoice: there’s improved support for RTL languages in the Dashboard.
* Get more info at a tap: Tapping on a product in any order will bring up a view-only version of the product details.
Nothing huge here! Just some improvements and bug fixes — you won’t notice anything except a smooth-running app.
Nothing huge here! Just some improvements and bug fixes — you won’t notice anything except a smooth-running app.
This version of the app does a better job adjust large font sizes for little phone screens — if you use iOS’s dynamic type settings, you won’t see any more comically large text.
This version of the app does a better job adjust large font sizes for little phone screens — if you use iOS’s dynamic type settings, you won’t see any more comically large text.

Copy tracking numbers! It is now easier to keep a watchful eye on your shipment without opening the app. In Order Details > Shipment Tracking > More, there is a new action to copy your tracking number to use wherever you want.

Goodbye stats error message! If your site does not have the Jetpack site stats module, or you don’t have permission to view stats, you simply won’t see the stats page. You don’t need to see an annoying error message, so we have taken it away.

Copy tracking numbers! It is now easier to keep a watchful eye on your shipment without opening the app. In Order Details > Shipment Tracking > More, there is a new action to copy your tracking number to use wherever you want.

Goodbye stats error message! If your site does not have the Jetpack site stats module, or you don’t have permission to view stats, you simply won’t see the stats page. You don’t need to see an annoying error message, so we have taken it away.

- Notifications are shown under “Orders,” so the “Notifications” tab was in need of a new identity. Since it actually just displays reviews, we’ve cunningly renamed it “Reviews.”
- There was a bug in the Order Details screen that created a weird UI with misplaced labels when you tried to refresh the information, and now there is not a bug there.
- There’s now a badge in the bottom tab, overlapping the “Orders” icon, so you can quickly see the number of orders you have in process.

- Notifications are shown under “Orders,” so the “Notifications” tab was in need of a new identity. Since it actually just displays reviews, we’ve cunningly renamed it “Reviews.”
- There was a bug in the Order Details screen that created a weird UI with misplaced labels when you tried to refresh the information, and now there is not a bug there.
- There’s now a badge in the bottom tab, overlapping the “Orders” icon, so you can quickly see the number of orders you have in process.

- Some of you could see your site on the login screen, but couldn’t tap Continue. Well, we fixed that.
- Being a prolific seller is something to celebrate — so we made the Orders badge a lot .easier to read.
- We discovered you could no longer automatically download product images from the Order Detail screen. We’ve restored the ability to download them.

- Some of you could see your site on the login screen, but couldn’t tap Continue. Well, we fixed that.
- Being a prolific seller is something to celebrate — so we made the Orders badge a lot .easier to read.
- We discovered you could no longer automatically download product images from the Order Detail screen. We’ve restored the ability to download them.

- There’s a brand-new stats page (with more granular analytics) for those of you who use the WooCommerce Admin plugin! You can opt in to use it from the Settings page.
- We fixed a bug that showed prices in the wrong currency on the Product Details page.
- After discovering that app logs could be edited, we’ve made sure they’re copy-only going forward.
- Now that the Orders tab displays all your order information, we’ve streamlined the My Store tab and removed the New Orders card from it.
- You probably want Reviews to be localized, and now they are (there was a bug; we fixed it).

- There’s a brand-new stats page (with more granular analytics) for those of you who use the WooCommerce Admin plugin! You can opt in to use it from the Settings page.
- We fixed a bug that showed prices in the wrong currency on the Product Details page.
- After discovering that app logs could be edited, we’ve made sure they’re copy-only going forward.
- Now that the Orders tab displays all your order information, we’ve streamlined the My Store tab and removed the New Orders card from it.
- You probably want Reviews to be localized, and now they are (there was a bug; we fixed it).

We’ve rearranged some parts of Order Details for better readability and usability: Customer payment details are more prominent, and Order Notes are grouped with date headings for easier scanning. And no more awkward expanding animation when you view the Billing Details!

We’ve rearranged some parts of Order Details for better readability and usability: Customer payment details are more prominent, and Order Notes are grouped with date headings for easier scanning. And no more awkward expanding animation when you view the Billing Details!

* New! You can now preselect the current Order status when editing a list of order statuses.
* Improved! The "9+" badge on the Orders tab got a makeover. It no longer overlaps the tab label on iPhone SE/8 in landscape mode.
* Improved! The Top Performers list on the new stats page no longer has a dark header bar in Dark mode.
* Improved! On the Orders tab, the order status filter now sticks after changing an Order status.

* New! You can now preselect the current Order status when editing a list of order statuses.
* Improved! The "9+" badge on the Orders tab got a makeover. It no longer overlaps the tab label on iPhone SE/8 in landscape mode.
* Improved! The Top Performers list on the new stats page no longer has a dark header bar in Dark mode.
* Improved! On the Orders tab, the order status filter now sticks after changing an Order status.

* If your sales stats seemed odd because timezones were off, we found that bug and fixed it.
* Ever email a customer from the Order Details screen and notice that the navigation bar looked different than in the rest of the app? Now it’s consistent.
* The keyboard no longer covers the date picker in the Shipment Tracking extension, which makes it significantly easier to actually pick a date.

* If your sales stats seemed odd because timezones were off, we found that bug and fixed it.
* Ever email a customer from the Order Details screen and notice that the navigation bar looked different than in the rest of the app? Now it’s consistent.
* The keyboard no longer covers the date picker in the Shipment Tracking extension, which makes it significantly easier to actually pick a date.

- Improved: Order detail view now includes the order’s shipping method.
- Enhancement: Reviews tab now shows all Product Reviews.
- Modified: We updated the appearance of Order Details and temporarily disabled dark mode.
- Bug fix: Fixed UI appearance on cells of Order List when tapping with dark mode enabled.
- Bug fix: Reviews no longer convert to partial dark mode. Dark mode is coming soon!
- Bug fix: Order Details now has the correct space between cells.
- Bug fix: Settings no longer convert to partial dark mode.

- Improved: Order detail view now includes the order’s shipping method.
- Enhancement: Reviews tab now shows all Product Reviews.
- Modified: We updated the appearance of Order Details and temporarily disabled dark mode.
- Bug fix: Fixed UI appearance on cells of Order List when tapping with dark mode enabled.
- Bug fix: Reviews no longer convert to partial dark mode. Dark mode is coming soon!
- Bug fix: Order Details now has the correct space between cells.
- Bug fix: Settings no longer convert to partial dark mode.

- Enhancement: Reviews tab now shows all Product Reviews.
- Modified: We updated the appearance of Order Details and temporarily disabled dark mode.

- Bug fix: Reviews no longer convert to partial dark mode. Dark mode is coming soon!

- Bug fix: Settings no longer convert to partial dark mode.

- Enhancement: Reviews tab now shows all Product Reviews.

- Bug fix: Reviews no longer convert to partial dark mode. Dark mode is coming soon!

- Bug fix: Settings no longer convert to partial dark mode.

- Fans of dark mode, rejoice! It’s here.
- Fans of previewing things, you can rejoice too! We know a Products tab is high on people’s wish lists. While we’re not ready to fully release a version of the app that includes it, you can preview the coming-soon Products tab right now — head to Settings in the app to enable it.

- Fans of dark mode, rejoice! It’s here.
- Fans of previewing things, you can rejoice too! We know a Products tab is high on people’s wish lists. While we’re not ready to fully release a version of the app that includes it, you can preview the coming-soon Products tab right now — head to Settings in the app to enable it.

- Fans of dark mode, rejoice! It’s here.
- Fans of previewing things, you can rejoice too! We know a Products tab is high on people’s wish lists. While we’re not ready to fully release a version of the app that includes it, you can preview the coming-soon Products tab right now — head to Settings in the app to enable it.

- Fans of dark mode, rejoice! It’s here.
- Fans of previewing things, you can rejoice too! We know a Products tab is high on people’s wish lists. While we’re not ready to fully release a version of the app that includes it, you can preview the coming-soon Products tab right now — head to Settings in the app to enable it.

- The Fulfill Order screen displays the full contents of customer-provided notes (when there is one) instead of cutting them off after single line, so you can see all the detail on one screen.
- The count on the Orders tab bar now correctly refreshes when you switch between stores.
- Quirks are intriguing in people and a lot less intriguing in apps, so we took care of a few bugs that caused some visual quirks (in particular, when changing system font sizes).

- The Fulfill Order screen displays the full contents of customer-provided notes (when there is one) instead of cutting them off after single line, so you can see all the detail on one screen.
- The count on the Orders tab bar now correctly refreshes when you switch between stores.
- Quirks are intriguing in people and a lot less intriguing in apps, so we took care of a few bugs that caused some visual quirks (in particular, when changing system font sizes).

- The Fulfill Order screen displays the full contents of customer-provided notes (when there is one) instead of cutting them off after single line, so you can see all the detail on one screen.
- The count on the Orders tab bar now correctly refreshes when you switch between stores.
- Quirks are intriguing in people and a lot less intriguing in apps, so we took care of a few bugs that caused some visual quirks (in particular, when changing system font sizes).
- Adds additional logging to help us track down a tricky bug.

- The Fulfill Order screen displays the full contents of customer-provided notes (when there is one) instead of cutting them off after single line, so you can see all the detail on one screen.
- The count on the Orders tab bar now correctly refreshes when you switch between stores.
- Quirks are intriguing in people and a lot less intriguing in apps, so we took care of a few bugs that caused some visual quirks (in particular, when changing system font sizes).
- Adds additional logging to help us track down a tricky bug.

- A well-designed app is a joy to use, so we took care of an alignment bug on the order details screen, made some enhancements to dark mode, hid the shipping address for virtual products on the order details screen, and added a nice placeholder image when there are no products to show in a product list.
- There are three fewer bugs in the world: if you ever tapped on a new order push notification and ended up looking at reviews instead of orders, switched stores and ended up with an incorrect product listing, or didn’t see you product variations on a single product screen, those are now experiences of the past.

- A well-designed app is a joy to use, so we took care of an alignment bug on the order details screen, made some enhancements to dark mode, hid the shipping address for virtual products on the order details screen, and added a nice placeholder image when there are no products to show in a product list.
- There are three fewer bugs in the world: if you ever tapped on a new order push notification and ended up looking at reviews instead of orders, switched stores and ended up with an incorrect product listing, or didn’t see you product variations on a single product screen, those are now experiences of the past.

- If the app is in the foreground and you get a push notification, the badges on the Orders tab and Reviews tab will update correctly based on the type of the notification.
- Sometimes after logging out and back in, the Product List would be empty even though you clearly have products. The Product List now lives up to its name and shows products from the correct store. Can’t find the Products list? Go into the “Experimental Features” menu in Settings to enable the sneak preview.

- If the app is in the foreground and you get a push notification, the badges on the Orders tab and Reviews tab will update correctly based on the type of the notification.
- Sometimes after logging out and back in, the Product List would be empty even though you clearly have products. The Product List now lives up to its name and shows products from the correct store. Can’t find the Products list? Go into the “Experimental Features” menu in Settings to enable the sneak preview.

- You can now view refunds on an order.
- The “orders to fulfill” badge now maxes at 99, showing 99+ for anything over 99. Previously, it was 9+.
- Fixed a bug where long product names could make the product quantity disappear when viewing an order.
- Product names with HTML escape characters should display correctly now.
- If an order has multiple products, tapping on any product should open the correct product.

- You can now view refunds on an order.
- The “orders to fulfill” badge now maxes at 99, showing 99+ for anything over 99. Previously, it was 9+.
- Fixed a bug where long product names could make the product quantity disappear when viewing an order.
- Product names with HTML escape characters should display correctly now.
- If an order has multiple products, tapping on any product should open the correct product.

- In the dashboard, tapping on a product in the “Top Performers” section opens the product detail.
- The orders tab now localizes both item quantities and the order badge.

- In the dashboard, tapping on a product in the “Top Performers” section opens the product detail.
- The orders tab now localizes both item quantities and the order badge.

To offer a more complete picture of your earnings, dashboard stats now also include negative revenue (for example: refunds).

- We’ve redesigned the Orders List to make the Processing and All Orders views more prominent. Want to filter orders by a different status? No worries: you’ll find other options in the Search view.
- Reviews are so important for online stores, but they would occasionally fail to load on some WooCommerce configurations. We fixed it.
- Raise your hand if you’d like to edit products on the go! Give available editing options a try on your simple products (but first, you’ll need to enable it: go to Settings > Experimental Features > Products).

To offer a more complete picture of your earnings, dashboard stats now also include negative revenue (for example: refunds).

- We’ve redesigned the Orders List to make the Processing and All Orders views more prominent. Want to filter orders by a different status? No worries: you’ll find other options in the Search view.
- Reviews are so important for online stores, but they would occasionally fail to load on some WooCommerce configurations. We fixed it.
- Raise your hand if you’d like to edit products on the go! Give available editing options a try on your simple products (but first, you’ll need to enable it: go to Settings > Experimental Features > Products).

A short list of changes this time around:

- The order status label in the Order List no longer gets cut off, so you can actually see all the information.
- If you ever wondered why the Woo logo on the launch screen looked a little stretched out, its because the aspect ratio was wonky — that’s fixed now.
- For clarity, you’ll now see “Shipping Carrier” throughout the app instead of “Shipping Provider.”

Stay safe and wash your hands, everyone!

A short list of changes this time around:

- The order status label in the Order List no longer gets cut off, so you can actually see all the information.
- If you ever wondered why the Woo logo on the launch screen looked a little stretched out, its because the aspect ratio was wonky — that’s fixed now.
- For clarity, you’ll now see “Shipping Carrier” throughout the app instead of “Shipping Provider.”

Stay safe and wash your hands, everyone!

* We’re excited to introduce a Products tab!
* Users also now have limited editing capabilities for Simple Products, with more to come.
* We’ve made a fix so that, whenever you refresh the Processing tab, it will show your up-to-date orders.

* We’re excited to introduce a Products tab!
* Users also now have limited editing capabilities for Simple Products, with more to come.
* We’ve made a fix so that, whenever you refresh the Processing tab, it will show your up-to-date orders.
* We fixed an impolite bug that would sometimes crash the app while you were downloading Orders. Download away, we say!
* We fixed an impolite bug that would sometimes crash the app while you were downloading Orders. Download away, we say!

* Easier product description editing: Tap anywhere on a product cell to start editing. Need the keyboard? It pops up automatically. And while we were at it, we fixed a couple of bugs.
* Up-to-the-minute order reporting: The Order list refreshes automatically every time you open the app or get a new order, and the Processing Orders list now shows upcoming future orders.

* Easier product description editing: Tap anywhere on a product cell to start editing. Need the keyboard? It pops up automatically. And while we were at it, we fixed a couple of bugs.
* Up-to-the-minute order reporting: The Order list refreshes automatically every time you open the app or get a new order, and the Processing Orders list now shows upcoming future orders.

* You can now turn Products M2 Features on and off for simple products in Settings > Experimental Features. Products M2 features the ability to update product images, product short description, product viewing, sharing, and settings (Product settings include status, visibility, catalog visibility, slug, purchase note, and menu order.)
* You can now edit and save details on the Order details or Top Performers tabs. We’ve also improved accessibility with better VoiceOver support for Product Price settings.
* We’ve made some visual refinements: In Order Details, the Payment card now appears right after the Products and Refunded Products cards. The WIP banner on the Products tab is now collapsed by default. Yay for more vertical space!
* We’ve dropped support for iOS 11 and lower.

* You can now turn Products M2 Features on and off for simple products in Settings > Experimental Features. Products M2 features the ability to update product images, product short description, product viewing, sharing, and settings (Product settings include status, visibility, catalog visibility, slug, purchase note, and menu order.)
* You can now edit and save details on the Order details or Top Performers tabs. We’ve also improved accessibility with better VoiceOver support for Product Price settings.
* We’ve made some visual refinements: In Order Details, the Payment card now appears right after the Products and Refunded Products cards. The WIP banner on the Products tab is now collapsed by default. Yay for more vertical space!
* We’ve dropped support for iOS 11 and lower.

We’re continuing to add functionality to product editing. Look out for improvements to image and product management — head to “Settings” in the My Store tab to learn more and turn on the new features!

Push notifications and update badges work better together. The Reviews tab no longer shows a badge after you receive a new order push notification, and navigating to the Orders and/or the Reviews tab now clears the badge number (depending on the types of notifications).

Nudges are a bit less nudge-y. When editing products, the “discard changes” prompt now only appears if you’ve deleted images, and not when you’re leaving product settings detail screens with a text field (slug, purchase note, and menu order).

We also straightened out a few little UI foibles:
- The product name displays in the product details navigation bar, so it’s always visible.
- We fixed an issue that prevented the product details from scrolling all the way to the bottom in landscape mode after dismissing the keyboard.
- Images pending upload will be visible after editing product images from product details.
- The “View product in store” action displays only if the product is published.
- HTML codes in the shipping method are now shown correctly.

We’re continuing to add functionality to product editing. Look out for improvements to image and product management — head to “Settings” in the My Store tab to learn more and turn on the new features!

Push notifications and update badges work better together. The Reviews tab no longer shows a badge after you receive a new order push notification, and navigating to the Orders and/or the Reviews tab now clears the badge number (depending on the types of notifications).

Nudges are a bit less nudge-y. When editing products, the “discard changes” prompt now only appears if you’ve deleted images, and not when you’re leaving product settings detail screens with a text field (slug, purchase note, and menu order).

We also straightened out a few little UI foibles:
- The product name displays in the product details navigation bar, so it’s always visible.
- We fixed an issue that prevented the product details from scrolling all the way to the bottom in landscape mode after dismissing the keyboard.
- Images pending upload will be visible after editing product images from product details.
- The “View product in store” action displays only if the product is published.
- HTML codes in the shipping method are now shown correctly.

- Product enhancements: Update product images, product settings, and share product links right from the app. No need to use that pesky desktop computer!
- Visual enhancements: In Order Details, the SKU no longer appears on the Products List. Also, the Simple product name and ellipsis menu now appears in the nav bar when opened outside the Products tab.(Be sure to enable the Products feature switch.) Last but not least, the loading state on the product variations screen looks spiffy now, wouldn’t you agree?
- California users can view their very own privacy notice.

- Product enhancements: Update product images, product settings, and share product links right from the app. No need to use that pesky desktop computer!
- Visual enhancements: In Order Details, the SKU no longer appears on the Products List. Also, the Simple product name and ellipsis menu now appears in the nav bar when opened outside the Products tab.(Be sure to enable the Products feature switch.) Last but not least, the loading state on the product variations screen looks spiffy now, wouldn’t you agree?
- California users can view their very own privacy notice.

New alerts: When a simple product doesn’t have a price set, an “Add Price” placeholder shows up on the product details screen in the price row. App users who haven’t yet upgraded to WooCommerce 4.0 will see a banner indicating an upgrade available. Users who have already upgraded will see the new stats dashboard. If you haven’t yet upgraded, we encourage you to do so!

Fixes and adjustments: We fixed a bug where a negative value could result in a visual glitch appearing on the dashboard charts. We also removed the total orders row from the Products tab to avoid confusion since we aren’t showing it on the editable form for simple products.

New alerts: When a simple product doesn’t have a price set, an “Add Price” placeholder shows up on the product details screen in the price row. App users who haven’t yet upgraded to WooCommerce 4.0 will see a banner indicating an upgrade available. Users who have already upgraded will see the new stats dashboard. If you haven’t yet upgraded, we encourage you to do so!

Fixes and adjustments: We fixed a bug where a negative value could result in a visual glitch appearing on the dashboard charts. We also removed the total orders row from the Products tab to avoid confusion since we aren’t showing it on the editable form for simple products.

We have a couple of things to fill you in on:

Sometimes there was a crash when you sent an SMS from the app, no one wants to miss an SMS, so we went right ahead and fixed that.

Love stats? We sure do! We have been beavering away to make your stats experience even better. As long as you have WooCommerce 4.0 or WooCommerce Admin your stats graph will now match what you see in wp-admin. Snap! If you are on an older version of WooCommerce you’ll want to update so you don’t miss out!

We have a couple of things to fill you in on:

Sometimes there was a crash when you sent an SMS from the app, no one wants to miss an SMS, so we went right ahead and fixed that.

Love stats? We sure do! We have been beavering away to make your stats experience even better. As long as you have WooCommerce 4.0 or WooCommerce Admin your stats graph will now match what you see in wp-admin. Snap! If you are on an older version of WooCommerce you’ll want to update so you don’t miss out!
The WooCommerce app you know and love, now with swiping right/left enabled on product images. (Yes, that’s it!)
The WooCommerce app you know and love, now with swiping right/left enabled on product images. (Yes, that’s it!)

- Sign in with Apple at login.
- Experiment with new features in the Products section! Go to Settings to enable them.
- Edit products with ease: updates are now displayed in the product details after adjusting the sale price.
- Better manage your products: receive clear warnings when at least one variation does not have a price.
- Crash, be gone! Tap on a Product Review push notification with no issues.

- Sign in with Apple at login.
- Experiment with new features in the Products section! Go to Settings to enable them.
- Edit products with ease: updates are now displayed in the product details after adjusting the sale price.
- Better manage your products: receive clear warnings when at least one variation does not have a price.
- Crash, be gone! Tap on a Product Review push notification with no issues.

We have lots of improvements in both Order Details and Settings to report in this update.

In Order Details, you can now add a “Guest” placeholder when a customer name isn’t provided. In the Product Details sub-section, we have fixed the glitch where clicking outside of “Add more details” dismissed the whole section.

In Settings, the “Feature Request” button was replaced with “Send Feedback.”

We also made some changes if the Products switch is on in Settings > Experimental Features:

1. You can do some basic editing for non-core products, such as subscriptions, that are introduced by external plugins and not defined by default into WooCommerce’s four core groups (simple, variable, linked, and grouped). You can change images, name, description, price, inventory, tags, categories, short description, and product settings.
2. Inventory and shipping settings for product variations, including stock status, can now be edited.
3. The reviews row is hidden if reviews are disabled.
4. You can open the product’s review screen even if there are no reviews.
5. VoiceOver support in Product Details now includes the images header and the product name.

We have lots of improvements in both Order Details and Settings to report in this update.

In Order Details, you can now add a “Guest” placeholder when a customer name isn’t provided. In the Product Details sub-section, we have fixed the glitch where clicking outside of “Add more details” dismissed the whole section.

In Settings, the “Feature Request” button was replaced with “Send Feedback.”

We also made some changes if the Products switch is on in Settings > Experimental Features:

1. You can do some basic editing for non-core products, such as subscriptions, that are introduced by external plugins and not defined by default into WooCommerce’s four core groups (simple, variable, linked, and grouped). You can change images, name, description, price, inventory, tags, categories, short description, and product settings.
2. Inventory and shipping settings for product variations, including stock status, can now be edited.
3. The reviews row is hidden if reviews are disabled.
4. You can open the product’s review screen even if there are no reviews.
5. VoiceOver support in Product Details now includes the images header and the product name.

- Products: If the Products switch is on in Settings → Experimental Features for a variable product, the stock status is no longer shown in the product details when stock management is disabled (since stock status is controlled at variation level).
- Orders: The search list will now show the full count instead of “99+”.
- Reviews: We’ve fixed an issue where reviews were not refreshing correctly. Now, if you delete or mark a review as spam, this change will be reflected in the product reviews list.

- Products: If the Products switch is on in Settings → Experimental Features for a variable product, the stock status is no longer shown in the product details when stock management is disabled (since stock status is controlled at variation level).
- Orders: The search list will now show the full count instead of “99+”.
- Reviews: We’ve fixed an issue where reviews were not refreshing correctly. Now, if you delete or mark a review as spam, this change will be reflected in the product reviews list.

In this update, we have a lot of new possibilities for editing your products to report.

For non-core products — which are the products that WooCommerce does not group under simple, external, variable, or groups — there are a plethora of new editing options! You can now change the image, name, description, read-only price, read-only inventory, tags, short description, and product settings.

You can also now edit variable products, and stock status is included in the variation list.

Our core products also have additional fields that can be edited — tags, categories, product type, enable/ disable reviews, and visibility.

We also have an update for Apple Sign In — if you disconnect Apple ID from the WordPress app (Settings > Apple ID > Password & Security > Apps using Apple ID) the app will log out when you launch, or if you switch between apps. So you won’t stay logged in if you don’t want to!

In this update, we have a lot of new possibilities for editing your products to report.

For non-core products — which are the products that WooCommerce does not group under simple, external, variable, or groups — there are a plethora of new editing options! You can now change the image, name, description, read-only price, read-only inventory, tags, short description, and product settings.

You can also now edit variable products, and stock status is included in the variation list.

Our core products also have additional fields that can be edited — tags, categories, product type, enable/ disable reviews, and visibility.

We also have an update for Apple Sign In — if you disconnect Apple ID from the WordPress app (Settings > Apple ID > Password & Security > Apps using Apple ID) the app will log out when you launch, or if you switch between apps. So you won’t stay logged in if you don’t want to!

* Fixed! The footer in the app's Settings is now centered, draft products now sort from "Newest to Oldest" as expected, and the white background color has been removed from the placeholder view in the top dashboard chart in dark mode on iOS 14.
* Enhanced! Use the new date picker in iOS 14 to edit the date shipped in order details > add tracking and edit sale dates in details > price setting. Also, you'll see a "No Title" placeholder for products without a title in the products list.

* Fixed! The footer in the app's Settings is now centered, draft products now sort from "Newest to Oldest" as expected, and the white background color has been removed from the placeholder view in the top dashboard chart in dark mode on iOS 14.
* Enhanced! Use the new date picker in iOS 14 to edit the date shipped in order details > add tracking and edit sale dates in details > price setting. Also, you'll see a "No Title" placeholder for products without a title in the products list.

Products: You can now add simple, grouped, and external products and save products as drafts. We’ll have more new features for you to try out soon!

Other fixes: The Order Details screen now shows variation attributes for WooCommerce stores on version 4.7 and above. You may also notice that the Product Detail screen now shows the number of product ratings. Previously, it displayed the number of reviews, which was inaccurate.

Products: You can now add simple, grouped, and external products and save products as drafts. We’ll have more new features for you to try out soon!

Other fixes: The Order Details screen now shows variation attributes for WooCommerce stores on version 4.7 and above. You may also notice that the Product Detail screen now shows the number of product ratings. Previously, it displayed the number of reviews, which was inaccurate.

You asked, and we listened! You can now create simple, grouped, and external products for your store directly from your iPhone or iPad. Turn your ideas into products, even when you’re away from your computer.

That’s not all! We fixed problems, including a bug that meant newly submitted orders weren’t always showing up in an order list. We also made improvements. For instance, you can now issue refunds—for products or shipping—directly from the order screen.

You asked, and we listened! You can now create simple, grouped, and external products for your store directly from your iPhone or iPad. Turn your ideas into products, even when you’re away from your computer.

That’s not all! We fixed problems, including a bug that meant newly submitted orders weren’t always showing up in an order list. We also made improvements. For instance, you can now issue refunds—for products or shipping—directly from the order screen.

The app now supports iOS 13 and up which will allow for more rapid feature development.
We've fixed a bug that prevented thumbnail images from appearing for product variations on the order details screen, and centered the footer spinner vertically and horizontally.

The app now supports iOS 13 and up which will allow for more rapid feature development.
We've fixed a bug that prevented thumbnail images from appearing for product variations on the order details screen, and centered the footer spinner vertically and horizontally.

Products: All users can now add and edit linked products, add and edit downloadable files, and delete a product.

Shipping: You can now view shipping label details, request a refund, and reprint a shipping label with AirPrint.

Login: We’ve made various improvements to the login flow, including a better handling of errors.

Products: All users can now add and edit linked products, add and edit downloadable files, and delete a product.

Shipping: You can now view shipping label details, request a refund, and reprint a shipping label with AirPrint.

Login: We’ve made various improvements to the login flow, including a better handling of errors.

WooCommerce is excited to introduce the latest updates to its mobile app.

Refresh and Ready: Let’s say a user applies sorting parameters and/or filters to your store’s product list—chances are, when they return to the app, they don’t want to repeat that process. No problem! Now, if a user reopens the app, they’ll be able to see their previous settings.

Consolidation: The designated fulfillment screen is a thing of the past—fulfillment information now lives on the order details screen, as does info about fees.

Bugs Be Gone: We’ve fixed several glitches—here’s a taste:

- Billing information action sheets now present correctly on iPads.
- Rows in product search lists no longer have double separators.
- Loading spinners on “continue” buttons are now visible in dark mode.

What’s new in our 6.0 release?

You asked, we listened! Due to popular demand, the product SKU is displayed once again in the Order Details screen.

We also made various enhancements, including support for drag-and-drop sorting to Linked Products, consistency fixes to visitor stats in your dashboard and top performers in your “This Week” tab, and an improvement that reduces the risk of crashes when you update the app.

What’s new in our 6.0 release?

You asked, we listened! Due to popular demand, the product SKU is displayed once again in the Order Details screen.

We also made various enhancements, including support for drag-and-drop sorting to Linked Products, consistency fixes to visitor stats in your dashboard and top performers in your “This Week” tab, and an improvement that reduces the risk of crashes when you update the app.

We’re excited to announce updates to the WooCommerce iOS app.

It’s now easier than ever to edit the attributes of variable products — for instance, the color and size of clothing.
We fixed bugs affecting the “Back” button and the display of product thumbnails.
Plus, for items that fit the description, product type details now include “Downloadable.”

We’re excited to announce updates to the WooCommerce iOS app.

It’s now easier than ever to edit the attributes of variable products — for instance, the color and size of clothing.
We fixed bugs affecting the “Back” button and the display of product thumbnails.
Plus, for items that fit the description, product type details now include “Downloadable.”

- When editing a product, you can now create, delete, and update product variations, product attributes, and product attribute options.
- We’ve refreshed the design, including changes to your dashboard tabs. Feel free to share UI feedback with us so we can make improvements.
- Other various fixes.

- When editing a product, you can now create, delete, and update product variations, product attributes, and product attribute options.
- We’ve refreshed the design, including changes to your dashboard tabs. Feel free to share UI feedback with us so we can make improvements.
- Other various fixes.

WooCommerce iOS has updates that are sure to make running your business easier.

You can now create variable products from scratch and publish a product draft/pending product from the navigation bar.
We fixed glitches affecting the addition of product attributes or variations, and we improved the display of text and images in landscape orientation.

WooCommerce iOS has updates that are sure to make running your business easier.

You can now create variable products from scratch and publish a product draft/pending product from the navigation bar.
We fixed glitches affecting the addition of product attributes or variations, and we improved the display of text and images in landscape orientation.

What’s new in this release?

- A redesigned login experience, with new illustrations to promote the app’s main features and benefits.
- Other fixes, including making the back button style on your navigation bar more consistent.

What’s new in this release?

- A redesigned login experience, with new illustrations to promote the app’s main features and benefits.
- Other fixes, including making the back button style on your navigation bar more consistent.

We're busy working on lots of exciting things, so just one little fix this time. We now fully support product images with non-latin characters in the filename. They'll load nicely and won't cause weird issues with your Media Library.

We're busy working on lots of exciting things, so just one little fix this time. We now fully support product images with non-latin characters in the filename. They'll load nicely and won't cause weird issues with your Media Library.

Product variations only support one image, so if a product variation already has an image, you’ll see an option to replace or remove it but will not be able to add another one.

We received reports of crashes when selecting images from the Media Library, which occurred with libraries that had a specific number of images. This issue has been fixed.

We also improved an error message that displayed when a customer logged into a site with an offline device, an invalid SSL certificate, or a blocked XML-RPC. The updated messaging makes it easier for people to troubleshoot their login issue.

Product variations only support one image, so if a product variation already has an image, you’ll see an option to replace or remove it but will not be able to add another one.

We received reports of crashes when selecting images from the Media Library, which occurred with libraries that had a specific number of images. This issue has been fixed.

We also improved an error message that displayed when a customer logged into a site with an offline device, an invalid SSL certificate, or a blocked XML-RPC. The updated messaging makes it easier for people to troubleshoot their login issue.

If you are using the WooCommerce Product Add-ons extension (made by WooCommerce) and have been wanting to see those details when viewing an order, wait no longer! We have added experimental support to the app to show those add-ons in orders. To give it a try, head on over to Experimental Features in Settings to enable it. Please send us your feedback on your experience!

We’re also moving to support iOS 14 or later only with the next release after this one. To continue receiving updates to the WooCommerce app, please upgrade your device to iOS 14.
